abstract: Stocks had their biggest one-day gain in five years after the Federal Reserve said it would step up its lending to ease strain on the dysfunctional money market.
snippet: Stocks had their biggest one-day gain in five years after the Federal Reserve said it would step up its lending to ease strain on the dysfunctional money market.
lead_paragraph: Stocks had their biggest one-day gain in five years Tuesday after the Federal Reserve announced that it would step up its lending to ease strain on the dysfunctional money market.

headline.main: Dow Climbs 416.66 for Its Biggest Gain in Over 5 Years
headline.print_headline: Fed Steps In, And Stocks Take Off; Dow Up 416

byline.original: By Vikas Bajaj and Michael M. Grynbaum
